image.altText: Sheep lining up along a feed trail on a brown, dusty paddock

props.synopsis: As floods batter some parts of Australia, others are experiencing their worst drought on record. The two extremes may give a glimpse of our future climate.

title.children: Flooded towns give way to dustbowls in a land of weather extremes

image.altText: Anthony Albanese raises hands with son, partner and Penny Wong in front of a crowd.

props.synopsis: Over four months, Labor clawed its way back from an uninspiring showing in the polls to a historic victory so unbelievable even the party's most faithful servants couldn't have imagined it.

title.children: How Labor pulled off a landslide no one saw coming

image.altText: Littleproud has his elbows on a table, and is laughing. He has dark-rimmed glasses.

props.synopsis: Two consecutive federal losses and it's clear Australians aren't buying the dark and bleak interpretation of our circumstances.

title.children: Littleproud's week of living dangerously exposes how broken the right is

image.altText: Tim Wilson and Zoe Daniel.

props.synopsis: Following the completion of a full distribution of preferences in the inner-Melbourne seat on Saturday, giving Liberal candidate Tim Wilson a win by 260 votes, independent MP Zoe Daniel has asked for a recount, claiming "errors" and "votes moving to and fro in the final stages of the count".

title.children: Zoe Daniel calls for recount after Tim Wilson wins Goldstein by 260 votes

image.altText: A composite of two men

props.synopsis: Two Palestinians released during the Gaza ceasefire have detailed shocking claims against Israeli forces, while the IDF insists all prisoners and detainees were treated appropriately. WARNING: Some readers might find the details and images in this story distressing.

title.children: Shackled, blindfolded, beaten: Gaza detainees allege torture by IDF

image.altText: Illustration of woman standing under umbrella with lots of writing bouncing off the outside umbrella.

props.synopsis: With burnout at unprecedented levels who doesn't dream of stepping away from it all and embracing a career break. But can it solve the problem?

title.children: Meet the burnt-out millennials who walked away from work and found life

image.altText: Downtown Port Macquarie flooding

props.synopsis: Several communities in New South Wales are still cut off by floodwaters while they begin clean-up and recovery efforts. Follow live.

title.children: Flood-affected communities begin clean-up as warnings slowly downgrade

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Interstate help arrives to support NSW SES

image.altText: Angus Taylor, Jim Chalmers 20221026_192814850_iOS

props.synopsis: Treasurer Jim Chalmers held a press conference last week that will enter Australian political folklore, announcing major twin victories: one economic, one political.

title.children: Chalmers did not miss historic moment to take revenge on 'smoking ruin'

image.altText: A young white family of four with two young daughters sitting by a couch

props.synopsis: When Kate and Dan Walls found out their daughter Charlie was Deaf, they knew it wasn't something they wanted to fix and move on from. Instead, they've embraced it.

title.children: When Kate had a Deaf child, she made a decision others might not have

image.altText: Ed Husic stands in front of a blue curtain and the Australian flag.

props.synopsis: In a piece for The Guardian, Mr Husic says Australia "can and should be doing more" to pressure Israel, as it faces criticism from the United Nations and some former allies for only allowing "minimal" aid into war-torn Gaza.

title.children: Dumped minister Ed Husic pens op-ed criticising Labor for Gaza response

image.altText: Russia Ukraine missile

props.synopsis: Russia has launched a drone and ballistic missile attack on the Ukrainian capital overnight, which officials have described as one of the largest of the war.

title.children: Russia launches 'massive' aerial attack on Kyiv as prisoner swap begins

image.altText: A girl with blue eyes and smiling at the camera

props.synopsis: The family of missing 17-year-old Pheobe Bishop have issued a statement, while forensic police have collected a number of items from bushland west of Bundaberg as part of their investigations into her disappearance.

title.children: Family describes missing teen Pheobe Bishop as 'feisty' and 'strong-willed'

image.altText: Police standing next to a police car at dusk in Melbourne

props.synopsis: A 34-year-old woman has been killed in a police shooting, officers say, after she drove a vehicle at police who were arresting a machete-wielding man.

title.children: Woman who drove at officers during machete arrest shot dead by police

image.altText: A portrait of Queen Mary wearing a white dress and blue slash and a crown.

props.synopsis: Queen Mary of Teck, grandmother of Queen Elizabeth II, was a reserved intellectual. But some historians and descendants argue she was also an "upmarket kleptomaniac".

title.children: Was this English queen a 'predatory' collector of beautiful things?

image.altText: Tom Gleeson standing with his arms crossed with a serious look on his face with th Hard quiz logo in the top left corner

props.synopsis: Dearest fans. It's exhausting berating you week after week for another average performance, so your beloved online quiz is taking a short break. Go out with a bang. It's time to play, HARD!

title.children: Is this the Hard Quiz where you finally impress yourself?

image.altText: A Grok logo can be seen faintly against a dark background. A search field that reads 'What do you want to know?' is displayed

props.synopsis: For hours last week, X's AI chatbot Grok brought up claims of a "white genocide" under swathes of unrelated posts. For some, it was a warning about how we use AI.

title.children: Grok's fixation on a 'white genocide' gave a window into the pitfalls of chatbots

image.altText: Black and white photo of three relaxed men in military uniform sitting with snow-capped peaks in the background

props.synopsis: In the closing years of World War II, more than 500 Australian and New Zealand POWs risked capture — and death — by fleeing Nazi-occupied Italy in a 100-kilometre alpine trek to safety in Switzerland.

title.children: From POWs to freedom: The forgotten alpine escape of Australian soldiers

image.altText: A man stands on a boat, menacingly

props.synopsis: Cannes has historically allowed a peek into what will be rocking cinemas and award ceremonies over the next year. Here's what Australia brought to the mix.

title.children: Why Cannes Film Festival might be able to pick next year's Oscar winners

image.altText: Roosters and Sharks players stand next to each other

props.synopsis: The under-manned Roosters have humbled the full-strength Sharks in Gosford, with a debutant scoring with his second touch in first grade. Earlier, Penrith are bottom of the ladder after suffering a 25-6 defeat against Newcastle in Bathurst.

title.children: Roosters stun Sharks in Gosford, Panthers fall to bottom of ladder

image.altText: GettyImages-2216817013

props.synopsis: Collingwood weathers a North Melbourne storm as Nick Daicos stars, Alex Pearce faces scrutiny over a big hit, and a 100m goal stuns punters in the VFL.

title.children: Daicos magic kills off North upset, as 100m goal stuns in the VFL

image.altText: Melbourne Victory players celebrate

props.synopsis: Melbourne City will face Melbourne Victory in the ALM grand final for the first time after winning their semifinal against Western United 4-1 on aggregate.

title.children: City tee up first ever grand final Melbourne derby against Victory

image.altText: An SES worker in deep water

props.synopsis: NSW Police have launched an investigation into the death of a 60-year-old woman in floodwaters, after her body was found in a vehicle in the town of Dorrigo. Meanwhile, Sydney's Warragamba Dam is predicted to spill on Saturday evening.

title.children: Warragamba Dam reaches capacity, as police investigate woman's death in NSW floods

image.altText: A woman with long bright red hair, wearing all black, walks down the street, smiling.

props.synopsis: Union boss Diana Asmar had a clear message for her branch: The traitors who'd betrayed her had no idea what was coming. But the leader herself took the fall.

title.children: 'Regret the day she was born': Labor powerbroker unseated by 'traitors'

image.altText: Chef cooking beef with China and Australian flags in the background

props.synopsis: At a major food trade show in Shanghai this week, it became clear that Australia is now dominating the premium beef market in China.

title.children: Trump's trade war puts Aussie beef centre stage in Shanghai

image.altText: Elon Musk stands in front of a screen and waves.

props.synopsis: Elon Musk has become a hero in some MAGA circles, but Democrats are moving to reverse the help they have given his electric car company in the past.

title.children: DOGE prompts New York leaders to threaten Tesla to get at Musk

image.altText: Dead sea life under the water, grey clouds above the water

props.synopsis: A mysterious brown foam appeared on a beach south of Adelaide. It was just the beginning of a toxic algal bloom that has now grown to thousands of square kilometres in size, killing precious sea life in its wake.

title.children: 'This could be the beginning of the end': Toxic algal bloom a sign of a changing climate

image.altText: A satellite map showing the epicentre of the quake in the top left corner and cities Newcaste, Sydney and Wollongong.

props.synopsis: A "significant" earthquake and two aftershocks in the early hours rattle homes from the state's north-west to Sydney, with some reporting the ground shook for 30 seconds.

title.children: Beds shake, dogs go 'bonkers' as earthquakes rattle NSW

image.altText: Archive photo of the Dapto dog track

props.synopsis: The iconic Dapto Dogs greyhound races will end in 2026 after nearly 90 years, with the Dapto Agricultural and Horticultural Society confirming it will not renew the lease on the historic Wollongong track.

title.children: Dapto Dogs to stop running after 88 years as showground ends lease

image.altText: Anthony Albanese points and looks serious

props.synopsis: But the last election campaign exposed the true decline in the quality and capacity of the parliamentary Coalition — as well as its underlying party machines — to do politics and to do policy in a way which means it can't be assumed this is just a temporary flesh wound.

title.children: Self-induced idiocy has exposed the Coalition for the fractured beast it is

image.altText: A single dingo lies down on sand

props.synopsis: Rangers say a dingo stabbed with a pocketknife by a bystander to halt its attack on a nine-year-old boy has been euthanased.

title.children: Dingo euthanased after it was stabbed to release child

image.altText: Donald Trump with fist in the air

props.synopsis: US 10-year Treasury bonds have long been considered "risk-free" — until now. That's put the usually circumspect Reserve Bank of Australia "on alert" for a potentially "cataclysmic" economic event.

title.children: Trump's 'Big Beautiful Bill' has investors worried

image.altText: Melbourne Victory players celebrate

props.synopsis: Melbourne City will face Melbourne Victory in the ALM grand final for the first time after winning their semifinal against Western United 4-1 on aggregate.

title.children: City tee up first ever grand final Melbourne derby against Victory

image.altText: Models on a runway.

props.synopsis: According to the latest National Waste Report, the average Australian throws out about 11 kilograms of clothing each year. But what if some of that could be composted?

title.children: Paper clothes are turning heads and they're more durable than you think

image.altText: A banner with videos and word 'Fake'

props.synopsis: As a deadly attack shook Kashmir, sparking conflict between India and Pakistan, a war of misinformation was playing out online.

title.children: 'Spreading like wildfire': The online deepfake war being waged by India and Pakistan

image.altText: A close up photo of Erin Patterson looking over her shoulder wearing glases.

props.synopsis: A web of messages, search histories, and reset phones has emerged in the Erin Patterson trial. But can digital evidence explain what happened at her dinner table?

title.children: Mother, cook, defendant: Trial of Erin Patterson turns to her personal life
